channel.title: Halp me with objects
channel.description:
Hi thar, been stuck trying to find out how to do this sort of thing in Java for a few days now and I can't find any tutorials which explain what I am supposed to do.
Firstly I create 2 Class's
so I can reference the other class from making it an object etc by saying class2 c = new class2();
and then i can reference its methods or fields by doing c.field1; c.fieldx; etc
but I can only do this from one method in my Class1 (The method that I created the class in).
How can I make it so that any method in Class1 can use the (e.g.)c.field1 reference?
Sorry I can't explain much better. Thanks.

item.title: Halp me with objects
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Ahhhh, I see what you’re talking about!

Instead of doing this: (btw the following code obviously gives errors.)

[code]public class class1 {
public void someMethod() {
class2 c = new class2();
c.suckDick();
}

public void anotherMethod() {
    c.suckAnotherDick();
}

}[/code]

do this:

[code]public class class1 {
public class1() {
c = new class2();
}

public void someMethod() {
    c.suckdicks();
}

public void anotherMethod() {
    c.suckAnotherDick();
}

private class2 c;

}[/code]

note: private means only methods in class1 can access it.

nomsain?

Read full topic

item.title: Halp me with objects
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Make the class 2 instance a field in class 1

Read full topic

item.title: Halp me with objects
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

xEnt:

Use it static if it makes it easier and doesn’t need to use the class constructor. But that could cause a bad habit.

Please shut the fuck up and get a clue about what a static field is.

Read full topic

Sorry, I meant you create the variable in class1, not class2

make the field public

item.title: Halp me with objects
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Thanks, I don’t understand how to create an instance of itself as a variable in class2?

Read full topic

item.title: Halp me with objects
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

well, c is an instance of class2.

You’re accessing a field that is only available when referring to an instance of class2, so you need to declare “c” or whatever you want the instance to be called as a variable in class2, if not you will only be able to reference “c” from the scope in which is was declared (in this case, the method you created it in).

Read full topic
